intro: Neurachne minor, commonly known as the lesser neurachne, is a small herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of eastern Australia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features slender, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers in clustered spikes during the spring and early summer. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils. Neurachne minor plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
